block.p: Lana Faye Taradash, a daughter of Anita and Howard M. Taradash of Nashville, was married on Friday to Adam David Scheiner, a son of Elayne Scheiner of North Brunswick, N.J., and Seth M. Scheiner of Kendall Park, N.J. Cantor Judith Steel officiated at Tribeca Rooftop in New York.

Ms. Taradash, 30, is keeping her name. She is a marketing assistant at Ark Asset Management in New York. She graduated cum laude from New York University and is to begin studying for a master's in social work at Boston University in September.

Lana Faye Taradash, a daughter of Anita and Howard M. Taradash of Nashville, was married on Friday to Adam David Scheiner, a son of Elayne Scheiner of North Brunswick, N.J., and Seth M. Scheiner of Kendall Park, N.J. Cantor Judith Steel officiated at Tribeca Rooftop in New York.

Lana Faye Taradash, a daughter of Anita and Howard M. Taradash of Nashville, was married on Friday to Adam David Scheiner, a son of Elayne Scheiner of North Brunswick, N.J., and Seth M. Scheiner of Kendall Park, N.J. Cantor Judith Steel officiated at Tribeca Rooftop in New York.

Ms. Taradash, 30, is keeping her name. She is a marketing assistant at Ark Asset Management in New York. She graduated cum laude from New York University and is to begin studying for a master's in social work at Boston University in September.
Her father is a magistrate judge for the Davidson County General Sessions Court in Nashville.
Mr. Scheiner, 43, is a senior stock portfolio manager at Voyageur Asset Management in Boston. He graduated cum laude from Rutgers and received an M.B.A. cum laude from N.Y.U.

His mother retired as a vocational rehabilitation counselor, in New Brunswick, for the New Jersey Department of Labor. His father retired as a professor of urban United States history and African-American history at Rutgers in New Brunswick. The bridegroom is a stepson of Eveline Scheiner.
